titleStmt.title: One story is good till the other is told. A Roman story told by Dick to Tom on a winters night concerning the ingratitude of the Romans to Julius Cæsar, that famous emperor who fell a sacrifice to the malice of some persons whom he had rais'd to great honours and preferment.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: p. [3] cropped with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
